intro: Albertisia villosa, commonly known as the woolly albertia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Albertisia villosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
